item.title: The Resurrection of Archie Bunker
item.description: You would think that in this “woke” era the comedies of Norman Lear would be better appreciated, but I don’t think his many efforts to reboot his old series are going anywhere. Not because of any politically touchy subject matter, but because he saw the humanity in all of his characters, including those like Archie Bunker who he used to illustrate everything he saw as wrong with modern American attitudes, but whom he based on his own beloved father.

item.description: There’s someone buried under there. That’s the name. And see the date? Poison! Get off!
